column4: Excuse me, could someone assist me with grub, I want to make Windows to boot first, and lower the timer to 2 seconds
do a 'grep ^title /boot/grub/menu.lst | nl -v 0', open menu.lst for editing and enter the number of the entry you want to boot in the line "default 0" instead of the 0
you will find the timeout option in that file as well.
thanks, ehm does it start from 0? That means number 4 is actually number 3? Does it count that "break line" as one too? Its just an empy line
it counts from 0 (that's why default 0 boots the first entry)
I don't know what you mean by "break line"
there is 4 OS there,  ubuntu, ubuntu recovery, ubuntu memtest, an empy line, and Windows
what number should I put.. 3, 4 or 5?
the number that shows in front of the entry that you want to boot when you run the command that I gave you.
cool, 4 it is :) thanks mate
strong British influence in Sweden, eh, mate? ;)
What else should we use, German?
no, that influence is exerted in the other direction (Sweden -> Germany)
Can I bother yo with something else, my I got no sound, I got a realtek chipset
I have to point you to the factoid. Come back when you know the specifics of the problem
done, still doesn't work.
be specific about the problem, and put the question to the channel (I'm logging off soon)
okay =) sorry
no worries
not specific enough. Report the experience you've had with the suggestions from the wiki help.
